enumMember.name: UNDEFINED
enumMember.description: The SCTP redundancy undefined status. SCTP association is closed.

enumMember.name: DORMANT
enumMember.description: All remote IP addresses are inactive.

enumMember.name: NOT_REDUNDANT
enumMember.description: Redundancy addresses are unreachable. All remote IP addresses except primary are inactive.

enumMember.name: REDUNDANT
enumMember.description: At least one remote IP address except primary is active.

enumMember.name: REDUNDANCY_NOT_POSSIBLE
enumMember.description: SCTP association has only one remote IP address.

class.name: SctpAssociation
class.description:
The SctpAssociation is a representation of the protocol relationship between two SCTP Endpoints.
It is composed of the two SCTP Endpoints and protocol state information.

attribute.name: localPortNumber
attribute.description: Local port number of the association.

attribute.name: localPrimaryAddress
attribute.description: Local IP address normally used for outgoing traffic.

attribute.name: remotePortNumber
attribute.description: Remote port number of the association.

attribute.name: remotePrimaryAddress
attribute.description: Remote IP address normally used for outgoing traffic.

attribute.name: associationState
attribute.description: The SCTP association state.

attribute.name: localIpAddress
attribute.description: One or several local IP addresses used by the association.

attribute.name: remoteIpAddress
attribute.description: One or several remote IP addresses used by the association.

attribute.name: sctpAssociationId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: redundancyStatus
attribute.description: SCTP redundancy status indicates if there are redundant remote IP addresses available for SCTP traffic.

class.name: SctpEndpoint
class.description: An SCTP Endpoint is the logical sender and receiver of SCTP packets. Dependencies: All AddressIPv4 MOs configured in SctpEndpoint MOs must refer to IP interfaces belonging to a single Router instance.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test="every $ip in @localIpAddress satisfies every $port in @portNumber satisfies count(../SctpEndpoint[$port eq @portNumber and $ip = @localIpAddress]) eq 1"> Bad configuration. SctpEndpoint="<value-of select="@sctpEndpointId"/>", the combination of the portNumber and IP adresses is not unique.</assert> <assert test="every $ip in @localIpAddress satisfies every $each_ip in (../SctpEndpoint/@localIpAddress) satisfies ($ip/../../@routerId eq $each_ip/../../@routerId)"><value-of select="."/>. Bad configuration: all AddressIPv4 MOs configured in SctpEndpoint MOs must refer to IP interfaces belonging to a single Router instance.</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: portNumber
attribute.description: Local port number for the SCTP endpoint.

attribute.name: sctpProfile
attribute.description: Reference to a SctpProfile.

attribute.name: sctpEndpointId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: localIpAddress
attribute.description: List of references to an AddressIPv4 MO or AddressIPv6 MO serving as local addresses for the endpoint. Only 1 address is supported in this release.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

mim.author: EAB/FJP/TA UABERPE
mim.name: RtnSCTP_
mim.description:
Decision MOM for SCTP.
Shall not be visible.

class.name: SctpProfile
class.description:
The SctpProfile defines the configuration that controls the behaviour of an SctpEndpoint.
The SctpProfile can be shared by one or more SctpEndpoint MOs.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='@assocMaxRtx ge @pathMaxRtx'><value-of select="."/> assocMaxRtx must be >= pathMaxRtx</assert> <assert test='@initRto ge @minRto'><value-of select="."/> initRto must be >= minRto</assert> <assert test='@initRto le @maxRto'><value-of select="."/> initRto must be <= maxRto</assert> <assert test='@maxRto gt @minRto'><value-of select="."/> maxRto must be > minRto</assert> <assert test='@maxActivateThr ge @minActivateThr'><value-of select="."/> maxActivateThr must be >= minActivateThr</assert> <assert test='@primaryPathMaxRtx le @pathMaxRtx'><value-of select="."/> primaryPathMaxRtx must be <= pathMaxRtx</assert> <assert test='@thrTransmitBuffer le @transmitBufferSize'><value-of select="."/> thrTransmitBuffer must be <= transmitBufferSize</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: dscp
attribute.description: The DSCP value.

attribute.name: incCookieLife
attribute.description:
Allowed increment of parameter valid.Cookie.Life in local node.
Applied when an increase of the parameter is requested from the remote node. A new value of the attribute does not apply to associations that are already established.

attribute.name: bundlingActivated
attribute.description:
States whether bundling is allowed for an endpoint.
True: An endpoint bundles chunks by including multiple chunks in one outbound SCTP packet. False: Bundling is not used.

attribute.name: bundlingTimer
attribute.description: Maximum allowed bundling delay.

attribute.name: heartbeatInterval
attribute.description: SCTP heartbeat interval.

attribute.name: hbMaxBurst
attribute.description: HB.MaxBurst value. A new value of the attribute does not apply to associations that are already established.

attribute.name: initialHeartbeatInterval
attribute.description:
Period for acceptance of a heartbeat acknowledge message during path probing.
It limits the intensity of heartbeats for path probing after association start-up.

attribute.name: heartbeatActivated
attribute.description:
States whether heartbeat is activated.
True: Activates heartbeats for SCTP endpoint. False: Disables heartbeats for SCTP endpoint.

attribute.name: initARWnd
attribute.description:
Value of the initial advertised receiver window credit (a_rwnd sent in the INIT message).
If the value of this attribute is increased, it applies to both existing and new associations. If the value is decreased, it does not apply to associations that are already established.

attribute.name: initRto
attribute.description:
RTO initial value.
A new value of the attribute does not apply to associations that are already established.

attribute.name: maxBurst
attribute.description: Maximum number of burst packets.

attribute.name: maxRto
attribute.description: Maximum RTO.

attribute.name: maxInStreams
attribute.description:
Maximum number of inbound streams to negotiate for an association.
A change to this attribute does not affect the existing associations. To apply a new value, the endpoint must be re-created.

attribute.name: maxInitRt
attribute.description:
Maximum number of retransmissions allowed for both INIT and COOKIE_ECHO chunks.
A new value of the attribute does not apply to associations that are already established.

attribute.name: maxOutStreams
attribute.description:
Maximum number of outbound streams to negotiate for an association.
A change to this attribute does not affect the existing associations. To apply a new value, the endpoint must be re-created.

attribute.name: maxShutdownRt
attribute.description: Maximum number of retransmissions during the shutdown phase of an association.

attribute.name: transmitBufferSize
attribute.description: Size of the buffer used for storing data pending to be sent or retransmitted in an association.

attribute.name: minRto
attribute.description: Minimum RTO.

attribute.name: thrTransmitBufferCongCeased
attribute.description:
Size of threshold of the transmit buffer in percentage when congestion cease indication is sent.
See also description of attribute thrTransmitBuffer.

attribute.name: thrTransmitBuffer
attribute.description:
Threshold of the transmit buffer size.
Upon exceeding this threshold the user of SCTP will be asked to stop sending data. This condition will persist until the occupancy of the transmit buffer drops below thrTransmitBufferCongCeased * thrTransmitBuffer.

attribute.name: alphaIndex
attribute.description: RTO alpha index.

attribute.name: betaIndex
attribute.description: RTO beta index.

attribute.name: maxActivateThr
attribute.description:
Maximum number of consecutive successful heartbeats.
It must be sent over the data transfer path (DTP) before switchback can be performed.

attribute.name: minActivateThr
attribute.description:
Minimum and initial number of consecutive successful heartbeats before switchback can be performed.
The minimum and initial value for the number of consecutive successful heartbeats that must be sent over the preferred primary path before switchback can be performed.

attribute.name: sackTimer
attribute.description:
The time delay for sending the Selective Acknowledgement (SACK).
Time is measured from receiving the DATA chunk to sending the SACK chunk.

attribute.name: cookieLife
attribute.description: Valid cookie life. A new value of the attribute does not apply to associations that are already established.

attribute.name: assocMaxRtx
attribute.description: Association maximum number of retransmissions packets.

attribute.name: pathMaxRtx
attribute.description:
Maximum number of consecutive retransmissions on an IP path.
An IP path is defined by the pair of local and remote IP addresses.

attribute.name: primaryPathMaxRtx
attribute.description:
Maximum value of the error counter of the current primary path before switchover.
In case of enabled Primary Path Avoidance(PPA), if the error counter of the primary path exceeds this value, SCTP chooses another current primary path.

attribute.name: maxSctpPduSize
attribute.description:
Maximum size of the SCTP PDU.
This is equal to the size of IP MTU minus the size of IP overhead.

attribute.name: sctpProfileId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: primaryPathAvoidance
attribute.description:
Whether SCTP can avoid primary path usage when it didn't work for the latest transmission.
True: Enable functionality. False: Disable functionality.

attribute.name: noSwitchback
attribute.description:
Recovery of the failed Primary Path does not invoke change of the (current) data transfer path.
True: No switchback. False: Switchback.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: bundlingAdaptiveActivated
attribute.description:
States whether adaptive bundling is applied. It is only applicable if bundlingActivated is set to true. According to traffic condition, SCTP bundles chunks by including multiple chunks in one outbound SCTP packet.
True : Adaptive bundling is enabled. False : Adaptive bundling is disabled.

class.name: Sctp
class.description: The Sctp is an abstraction of the SCTP system. The only purpose of this class is PM counters. Created automatically when the first SctpEndpoint is created.

attribute.name: sctpId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

class.name: ManagedObject
class.description: The ManagedObject MO represents a generic MO type. It does not represent any real resource in the system and can therefore not be instanciated. It is used as a MO-reference that can refer to multiple MO types.

slot.name: condition
slot.value: State change from CLOSED directly to ESTABLISHED.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of times that SCTP associations have made a direct transition from the CLOSED state to the ESTABLISHED state

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of received SCTP datagrams for which an SCTP association could not be determined.

slot.name: condition
slot.value: An SCTP datagram is received, but is not delivered due to inability to find the association and endpoint.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of times that SCTP associations have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from any state, using the chunk ABORT.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of received chunks dropped for the following reasons: - Invalid association state - Duplicated data - Invalid stream identity in the DATA_CHUNK - Invalid verification tag in the packet - Stale SACK_CHUNK received - Lack of receiving buffer - ULP buffer overflow.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of outgoing user messages originating from the application for this SCTP for which no problems were encountered to prevent their transmission but were discarded. User messages are discarded due to lack of thrTransmitBuffer.

slot.name: condition
slot.value: A sent user message is discarded.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of received control chunks. The counter does not include abnormal or discarded chunks.

slot.name: description
slot.value:
Number of out-of-the-blue packets that are received by the host.
These are SCTP packets that are correctly formed (with a correct checksum), but where the receiver is not able to identify the association to which this packet belongs.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of unordered chunks received from the peers.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of fragmented user messages, incremented when the first data chunk of fragmented message is sent.

slot.name: condition
slot.value: An SCTP packet with invalid checksum received.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of SCTP packets received from the peers, with an invalid checksum.

slot.name: condition
slot.value: State change from COOKIE-ECHOED directly to ESTABLISHED.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of times that SCTP associations have made a direct transition to the ESTABLISHED state from the COOKIE-ECHOED state.

slot.name: condition
slot.value: The first data chunk of a fragmented message is received.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of reassembled user messages, incremented when the first data chunk of a fragmented message is received.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of unordered chunks transmitted to the peers.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of transmitted ordered DATA chunks (excluding retransmissions).

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of received SCTP datagrams for which an SCTP association and endpoint could not be determined (for example if there was no user application at the destination port).

slot.name: condition
slot.value: An SCTP datagram is received, but is not delivered due to inability to find the association and endpoint.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of DATA chunks retransmitted to the peers.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of times SCTP has sent a congestion ceased indication to the user.

slot.name: condition
slot.value: A communication resume indication is sent.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of received packets, including duplicates and those received in error.

slot.name: description
slot.value:
Number of received ordered DATA chunks.
The counter does NOT include abnormal or discarded chunks.

slot.name: condition
slot.value: State change from SHUTDOWN-SENT or SHUTDOWN-ACK-SENT directly to CLOSED.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of times that SCTP associations have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the SHUTDOWN-SENT state or the SHUTDOWN-ACK-SENT state.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of times SCTP has sent a congestion indication to the user.

slot.name: condition
slot.value: A communication stop indication is sent.

slot.name: description
slot.value:
Number of times that the association has become unavailable to the SCTP user because all paths forming part of this association became inactive for one of the following reasons:
- Retransmission limit was reached - an ICMP message is received and is treated as if the retransmission limit was reached

slot.name: condition
slot.value: State change from any state directly to CLOSED after the maximum number of retransmissions is reached, or if an ICMP message is received and breaks the retransmission counter.

slot.name: description
slot.value:
Number of received control chunks.
The counter does not include abnormal or discarded chunks.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of octets in received packets for this association, including duplicates and those received in error.

slot.name: description
slot.value:
Number of seconds the association has been unavailable to the SCTP user.
Unit: 1 s

slot.name: condition
slot.value: The accumulated time in DISABLED operational state reaches one second.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of times that the association has become unavailable to the SCTP user due to ungraceful termination by the local or the remote side, using the chunk ABORT.Ungraceful termination during association establishment does not increment this counter.

slot.name: condition
slot.value: State change from ESTABLISHED to CLOSED, during ABORT.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of octets in transmitted packets.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of times that the association has started the zero window supervision procedure.

slot.name: condition
slot.value: The association starts the zero window supervision procedure.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of seconds that the remote peer has claimed to have zero window for its receive buffer.

slot.name: condition
slot.value: The accumulated time the association has spent on zero window supervision reaches one second.

slot.name: description
slot.value:
Number of received DATA chunks.
The counter does NOT include abnormal or discarded chunks.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of received control chunks which were discarded even though no errors were detected. Chunks can be discarded for the following reasons: - unsupported chunk type. - wrong association state.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of received DATA chunks that were discarded due to lack of space in the receive buffer.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of outgoing DATA chunks for this association for which no problems were encountered to prevent their transmission but were discarded. DATA chunks are discarded due to ungraceful closing of the association.

slot.name: condition
slot.value: An outgoing DATA chunk is discarded.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of times that the local transmission buffer for the association is congested.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of outgoing user data messages, which were discarded even though no problems were encountered to prevent their transmission. User messages are discarded due to lack of space in the transmission buffer.

slot.name: condition
slot.value: An outgoing user message is discarded.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of received control chunks which were chosen to be discarded due to errors in the chunk format or in the chunk content.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of received packets for this association, including duplicates and those received in error.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of received DATA chunks with errors in the chunk format or in the chunk contents preventing them from being delivered to the SCTP user.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of times that the association has become unavailable to the SCTP user due to graceful shutdown by the local or the remote side.

slot.name: condition
slot.value: State change from SHUTDOWN-SENT or SHUTDOWN-ACK-SENT directly to CLOSED.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of transmitted DATA chunks (excluding retransmissions).

slot.name: description
slot.value: Number of seconds that the local transmission buffer for the association is congested.

slot.name: condition
slot.value: The accumulated association congestion time reaches 1 second.
